conclusion: Analyze the geometry and angles within the triangular prism to calculate the angle of deviation.

The image depicts a triangular prism with ∠A = 90° and ∠B = 60°. A light beam starts from D on BC, reflects off E on AC, undergoes total internal reflection at F on AB, and exits. EG is perpendicular to AC, intersecting BC at G. D is the midpoint of CG.
∠A = 90° and ∠B = 60°, so ∠C = 30° because angles in a triangle sum to 180°.
EG is perpendicular to AC, so ∠EGC = 90°.
D is the midpoint of CG, implying DG = CG/2 = GC/2.
The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection at E, so ∠EDC = ∠ECD = 30°.
At F, the angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection, so ∠DFC = 60° due to internal reflection.
The angle of deviation of the light beam relative to D is the sum of the deviation angles at E and F, given by ∠DFC + ∠ECD.
The angle of deviation is thus 90°.
